cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW then NW and accelerate toward the central Gulf Coast, then move inland across the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast (likely southeast Louisiana / southern Mississippi)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Rio Lagartos (Mexico) including Cozumel, and Pinar del Rio (Cuba)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, and the central Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–35 mph possible late Thu–Fri as remnant circulation passes inland to the west
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Charleston due to inland track and offshore winds
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with localized higher amounts, leading to ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands cannot be ruled out
